# Red Converter - Comprehensive LLM Documentation
# https://red-conventer.airedcell.dev/
# Version: 2.0

================================================================================
                              OVERVIEW
================================================================================

Red Converter is a professional-grade, client-side text transformation and 
steganography Progressive Web Application (PWA). All processing occurs locally
in the user's browser - no data is ever transmitted to any server.

Author: AI RedCell
Founder: Shehan Nilukshan
Website: https://www.airedcell.dev/
Repository: https://github.com/AI-RedCell/red-converter
License: MIT (Open Source)

================================================================================
                         TRANSFORMATION ALGORITHMS
================================================================================

## 1. BASE ENCODINGS

### Base64
- Standards: RFC 4648
- Input: Any text/binary
- Output: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, =
- Use: Data transmission, email attachments
- Reversible: Yes

### Base32
- Standards: RFC 4648
- Input: Any text/binary
- Output: A-Z, 2-7, =
- Use: Case-insensitive encoding, DNS
- Reversible: Yes

### Base58
- Variant: Bitcoin alphabet
- Input: Any text/binary
- Output: 123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz
- Use: Cryptocurrency addresses (avoids 0, O, I, l confusion)
- Reversible: Yes

### Base85 (ASCII85)
- Format: Adobe variant with <~ ~> delimiters
- Input: Any text/binary
- Output: Printable ASCII (33-117)
- Use: PDF, PostScript
- Reversible: Yes

### Hexadecimal
- Input: Any text/binary
- Output: 0-9, a-f
- Use: Color codes, debugging, memory addresses
- Reversible: Yes

### Binary
- Modes: 7-bit, 8-bit
- Input: Any text
- Output: Space-separated binary strings
- Use: Educational, low-level representation
- Reversible: Yes

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 2. CLASSICAL CIPHERS

### Caesar Cipher
- Parameter: shift (default: 3)
- Method: Alphabetic shift
- Example: A‚ÜíD (shift 3)
- Reversible: Yes (with key)

### ROT13
- Fixed shift: 13
- Self-reciprocal: encode = decode
- Scope: A-Z, a-z only
- Reversible: Yes

### ROT47
- Fixed shift: 47
- Scope: ASCII 33-126
- Self-reciprocal: encode = decode
- Reversible: Yes

### Atbash
- Method: Alphabet reversal (A‚ÜîZ, B‚ÜîY, etc.)
- Self-reciprocal: encode = decode
- Reversible: Yes

### Vigen√®re Cipher
- Parameter: keyword
- Method: Polyalphabetic substitution
- Security: Moderate (vulnerable to frequency analysis)
- Reversible: Yes (with key)

### XOR Cipher
- Parameter: key string
- Method: Bitwise XOR
- Self-reciprocal: Yes
- Reversible: Yes (with key)

### Affine Cipher
- Parameters: a (multiplier), b (shift)
- Constraint: gcd(a, 26) = 1
- Formula: E(x) = (ax + b) mod 26
- Reversible: Yes (with parameters)

### Rail Fence Cipher
- Parameter: rails (number of rows)
- Method: Zigzag transposition
- Reversible: Yes (with rail count)

### Bacon Cipher
- Method: Biliteral cipher (A/B encoding)
- Output: 5-character groups
- Reversible: Yes

### Polybius Square
- Grid: 5x5 (I/J combined)
- Output: Two-digit coordinates
- Reversible: Yes

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 3. MODERN ENCRYPTION

### AES-256
- Algorithm: Advanced Encryption Standard
- Key size: 256 bits
- Mode: Default implementation
- Reversible: Yes (with password)

### Hashing (One-way)
- SHA-256: 256-bit digest
- SHA-512: 512-bit digest
- MD5: 128-bit digest (deprecated for security)
- Reversible: NO (one-way functions)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 4. STEGANOGRAPHY

### Zero-Width Steganography
- Characters: U+200B (ZWSP), U+200C (ZWNJ), U+200D (ZWJ)
- Method: Binary encoding in invisible characters
- Carrier: Optional visible text
- Features:
  - Encode secret in carrier text
  - Decode/extract hidden message
  - Reveal (visualize zero-width chars)
  - Remove (strip zero-width chars)
- Reversible: Yes

### Homoglyphs
- Levels: Light, Heavy
- Method: Latin ‚Üî Cyrillic lookalike substitution
- Light examples: a‚Üí–∞, e‚Üí–µ, o‚Üí–æ (Latin‚ÜíCyrillic)
- Use: Phishing awareness, obfuscation
- Reversible: Partial (Light level only)

### Whitespace Encoding
- Characters: Tab (1), Space (0)
- Method: Binary in whitespace
- Detection: Very hard visually
- Reversible: Yes

### Case Encoding
- Method: Uppercase=1, Lowercase=0
- Carrier: "thequickbrownfoxjumpsoverthelazydog"
- Reversible: Yes

### Punctuation Encoding
- Characters: Period (0), Comma (1)
- Method: Binary in punctuation
- Reversible: Yes

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 5. EMOJI ENCODING

### Emoji Alphabet
- Mapping: a‚Üíüçé, b‚Üíüçå, c‚Üíüê±, etc.
- Scope: a-z, 0-9, space
- Reversible: Yes

### Binary Emoji
- Characters: ‚ö´ (0), ‚ö™ (1)
- Method: 8-bit binary per byte
- Reversible: Yes

### Base64 Emoji
- Start: U+1F600 (üòÄ) + position
- Method: Base64 chars ‚Üí emoji sequence
- Reversible: Yes

### Emoji Skin Tone Steganography
- Base: üëã
- Tones: üèªüèºüèΩüèæüèø
- Method: Bytes encoded in skin tone pairs
- Reversible: Yes

### Emoji Noise
- Parameter: density (default: 0.3)
- Method: Random emoji insertion
- Reversible: Yes (noise removal)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 6. TEXT UTILITIES

### Morse Code
- Standard: International Morse
- Output: Dots/dashes, space separators
- Reversible: Yes

### Braille
- Modes: Alphabetic, Binary
- Alphabetic: Letter-to-Braille mapping
- Binary: ‚†ø (1), ‚†Ä (0) in 8-bit groups
- Reversible: Yes

### URL Encoding
- Standard: RFC 3986
- Method: Percent-encoding
- Reversible: Yes

### HTML Entities
- Types: Numeric (&#65;), Named (&amp;)
- Scope: Special characters + non-ASCII
- Reversible: Yes

### Unicode Escape
- Format: \uXXXX
- Scope: Characters > U+007F
- Reversible: Yes

### Leetspeak
- Levels: Light, Heavy
- Light: a‚Üí4, e‚Üí3, i‚Üí1, o‚Üí0, s‚Üí5, t‚Üí7
- Heavy: a‚Üí/-\, e‚Üí3, h‚Üí|-|, etc.
- Reversible: Light only

### Synonym Shuffle
- Method: Random synonym substitution
- Scope: Common words
- Reversible: NO

### Text Transforms
- Uppercase: toLowerCase ‚Üí toUpperCase
- Lowercase: toUpperCase ‚Üí toLowerCase
- Reverse: String reversal
- Reversible: Yes

================================================================================
                           PIPELINE SYSTEM
================================================================================

Red Converter features a pipeline-based transformation system:

1. Add multiple transformations in sequence
2. Each step processes the output of the previous step
3. Real-time preview of intermediate results
4. Drag-and-drop reordering
5. Warning system for incompatible combinations

Example Pipeline:
  Input: "secret message"
    ‚Üí Base64 Encode: "c2VjcmV0IG1lc3NhZ2U="
    ‚Üí ROT13: "p2Ixcek0gIk1elNhTLu="
    ‚Üí Zero-Width Encode (carrier: "Hello!"): "H‚Äåe‚Äçl‚Äål‚Äåo‚Äç!"
  Output: "Hello!" (with hidden encoded message)

================================================================================
                          ANALYSIS FEATURES
================================================================================

### Encoding Detection
- Automatic format recognition
- Pattern matching for common encodings
- Suggestions for appropriate decoders

### Frequency Analysis
- Character frequency distribution
- Useful for cryptanalysis

### Brute Force Caesar
- Tests all 26 shifts
- Displays all possibilities

### Character Statistics
- Character count
- Unique characters
- Byte size

================================================================================
                         TECHNICAL DETAILS
================================================================================

Frontend Stack:
- React 18+ with TypeScript
- Vite build system
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Framer Motion animations
- React Query for state management

PWA Features:
- Service Worker for offline caching
- Installable as native app
- Push notification ready

Storage:
- IndexedDB for transformation history
- No cookies, no tracking
- Complete privacy

Browser Support:
- Chrome 80+
- Firefox 75+
- Safari 14+
- Edge 80+

================================================================================
                        EXAMPLE INPUT/OUTPUT PAIRS
================================================================================

## Base64 Encoding
Input:  "Hello World"
Output: "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="

## Base64 Decoding
Input:  "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="
Output: "Hello World"

## Hexadecimal Encoding
Input:  "Secret"
Output: "536563726574"

## Hexadecimal Decoding
Input:  "536563726574"
Output: "Secret"

## Binary Encoding
Input:  "Hi"
Output: "01001000 01101001"

## Binary Decoding
Input:  "01001000 01101001"
Output: "Hi"

## ROT13 Encoding/Decoding
Input:  "Attack at dawn"
Output: "Nggnpx ng qnja"

## Caesar Cipher (Shift 3)
Input:  "HELLO"
Output: "KHOOR"

## Morse Code Encoding
Input:  "SOS"
Output: "... --- ..."

## Morse Code Decoding
Input:  "... --- ..."
Output: "SOS"

## URL Encoding
Input:  "Hello World!"
Output: "Hello%20World%21"

## URL Decoding
Input:  "Hello%20World%21"
Output: "Hello World!"

## Base58 Encoding
Input:  "Bitcoin"
Output: "4jJc4sAwPs"

## Braille Encoding
Input:  "abc"
Output: "‚†Å‚†É‚†â"

## Leetspeak Encoding
Input:  "elite"
Output: "3l1t3"

## Zero-Width Steganography
Input:  Secret="Hi", Carrier="Hello"
Output: "H‚Äåe‚Äçl‚Äålo" (invisible characters embedded)

## Emoji Alphabet
Input:  "cat"
Output: "üê±üçéüå≤"

## Atbash Cipher
Input:  "HELLO"
Output: "SVOOL"

## Vigen√®re Cipher (Key: "KEY")
Input:  "HELLO"
Output: "RIJVS"
